TopicTitle: [WIP] US Probes - Old and New - Dev Thread

Articles.Content: My next project will be near earth object probes. These will include Dawn, Deep Space 1, Deep Impact, NEAR and Stardust.

Here is something I resurrected quick from an old orbiter mod package, Vanguard-1. I will include it with the new large release of probes I am working on (perhaps sooner if I feel like it).

Edited November 1, 2014 by raidernick
Nice little probe. The original Stayputnik. Would be nice to have the rocket for it, FASA doesn't go that far back.

OK so I've been working on the next probe for release. This time I'm doing a NASA/ESA joint probe, Ulysses. It is pretty much done at this point, including the animations. I will maybe do one or two other probes before releasing this to make the update more substantial.
Always good to see a new toy on this thread.

Just finished the Dawn probe. Next I am going to work on NEAR or Stardust.

Edited November 11, 2014 by raidernick
Amazing as always! I swear your output keeps me from getting bored.
Deep Space 1 is done, continuing work on other probes.
I really like that Dawn probe, you have quite a collection now.
This is looking mighty fine. It's a shame we didn't had a good Delta II in quite a while... I suppose we better get on it with Kartoffelkuchen.

I know I originally said I didn't want to do rocket parts but I've been playing around with the injection stages of some of these probes as they are an integral part of the function of the probes. These stages are the IUS and PAM.

Here is my work so far on the IUS booster. It is two separate solid stages. The second stage has a extendable engine bell which I plan to make extend automatically when the engine is activated.
Some more work on the IUS. I added lot's of little details like wires, electrical boxes, junctions etc...

Oh my word yes!

Felger and I were *literally* just talking about how we really need an IUS, and how hard it is to make one via MODEL nodes, and how we really ought to request one, and presto!

Thanks a jillion! Looking great.
Really great looking parts.... Nice work...
It'll come with an IR-powered cradle for the Shuttle, too. Combined with the new CSS, it'll be a wonderful sight.

IUS is done. I will release a prerelease of it soon as I will be looking for feedback/help coming up with proper DV values for each stage. The values it has now are placeholders.

Up next is the IUS/shuttle cradle.

Edited November 14, 2014 by raidernick

IUS is done. I will release a prerelease of it soon as I will be looking for feedback/help coming up with proper DV values for each stage. The values it has now are placeholders.

Up next is the IUS/shuttle cradle.

http://i.imgur.com/nzqRqzK.jpg

You're turn around time on assets is incredible!! Well done. Congrats on another beautiful model.

IUS is done. I will release a prerelease of it soon as I will be looking for feedback/help coming up with proper DV values for each stage. The values it has now are placeholders.

Great looking new part.

I don't know if others have this issue, but I have trouble using solids on my upper stages.

I can't get precise orbits or planetary intercepts with them.

I know it isn't realistic, but would people prefer a throttleable version?

IUS is done. I will release a prerelease of it soon as I will be looking for feedback/help coming up with proper DV values for each stage. The values it has now are placeholders.

Up next is the IUS/shuttle cradle.

http://i.imgur.com/nzqRqzK.jpg

That's awesome!

Hopefully we will have the CSS back up and running soon at 100% so we can utilize the full capabilities of this? Also you could do some more shuttle launched probes and satellites. Only if you are up to it of course.

Love the stage. The foil should perhaps be more copper-colored than gold on that one, but that's my sole suggestion so far. Can't wait for the cradle, BTW. I'll make an interim update to CSS in preparation for that.

Love the stage. The foil should perhaps be more copper-colored than gold on that one, but that's my sole suggestion so far. Can't wait for the cradle, BTW. I'll make an interim update to CSS in preparation for that.

I hope it fits.

I hope it fits.

It has to be posted I am sorry!

I updated the IUS gold/copper color to be darker. Here is the prerelease version to test the IUS. I made the engines have the ability to shutdown so you can hotkey them in action groups and toggle them on and off to get a precise orbit/intercept. I gave them a large amount of DV, enough to escape the system and get to Eve. This allows you to use a light or heavy payload and still get precise orbits.

This prerelease also contains the Vanguard, Dawn and Deep Space 1 probes. The final release will contain several more probes.

https://www./?ngn8ydfnljtiuch

Edited November 14, 2014 by raidernick
Never thought I'd say this, but I agree with Dragon on all counts!
